title: Unable to create Quarkus project when using Maven 3.9.0

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

Unable to create Quarkus project when using Maven 3.9.0

GH Actions Windows runners are using Maven 3.9.0 now, Linux ones are on 3.8.7 atm.
CC @maxandersen @aloubyansky 

```
sdk use maven 3.9.0
 mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.16.2.Final:create \ 
    -DprojectGroupId=org.acme \
    -DprojectArtifactId=getting-started \
    -Dextensions='resteasy-reactive'
```

gives `Execution default-cli of goal io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.16.2.Final:create failed: A required class was missing while executing io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.16.2.Final:create: org/eclipse/aether/connector/basic/BasicRepositoryConnectorFactory`

Full details:

### Expected behavior

App is generated

### Actual behavior

Error is thrown

### How to Reproduce?

```
sdk use maven 3.9.0
 mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.16.2.Final:create \ 
    -DprojectGroupId=org.acme \
    -DprojectArtifactId=getting-started \
    -Dextensions='resteasy-reactive'
```
